events.name: Paper Presentation
events.description: Showcase your research and innovative ideas through paper presentations. This event provides a platform for students to present their technical papers and engage in academic discourse.
events.longDescription: The Paper Presentation event is designed to encourage students to conduct research, analyze topics, and present their findings. Participants will have the opportunity to present their papers to a panel of judges and receive valuable feedback. Topics can range from emerging technologies to innovative solutions for real-world problems.
rules: Paper must be original and unpublished
events.prize: Cash prizes and certificates for top 3 presentations

events.name: El Casino
events.description: Test your technical knowledge and quick thinking in this exciting quiz competition. Fast-paced questions covering various domains of electronics and technology.
events.longDescription: El Casino is a thrilling technical quiz competition that challenges participants' knowledge across multiple domains including electronics, programming, and general technology. Teams compete in multiple rounds with increasing difficulty levels. Quick thinking and teamwork are essential to succeed.
events.prize: Trophy and certificates for winning team

events.name: Electro Quest
events.description: An electrifying circuit design and implementation challenge. Design and build circuits to solve given problems within the time limit.
events.longDescription: Electro Quest challenges participants to design and implement electronic circuits to solve real-world problems. Participants will receive problem statements and must design, simulate, and implement working circuits. This event tests both theoretical knowledge and practical skills in electronics.
rules: Judging based on functionality and design

events.name: Circuit Debugging
events.description: Debug faulty circuits and identify issues. Test your troubleshooting skills and understanding of electronic circuits.
events.longDescription: Circuit Debugging is a hands-on event where participants are presented with faulty circuits and must identify and fix the issues. This event tests participants' ability to troubleshoot, use multimeters and oscilloscopes, and understand circuit behavior. Multiple circuits with varying difficulty levels will be provided.
rules: Tools and equipment will be provided
Points based on correctness and time taken

events.name: Locked In
events.description: An escape room style technical puzzle challenge. Solve technical riddles, decode circuits, and unlock the secrets to escape.
events.longDescription: Locked In is an innovative escape room-style event with a technical twist. Teams must solve a series of technical puzzles, decode circuits, analyze codes, and work together to unlock the final challenge. This event combines logic, technical knowledge, and teamwork in an exciting format.
events.prize: Gift vouchers and certificates for all participants
